channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How Pennsylvanians are feeling about the economy ahead of Trump's rally
item.description: Affordability was a huge theme of Trump's campaign and is top of mind for the GOP as he heads to Pennsylvania for a rally. How are Pennsylvanians feeling, and can the GOP salvage its economic message?
item.content:encoded: Affordability was a huge theme of Trump's campaign and is top of mind for the GOP as he heads to Pennsylvania for a rally. How are Pennsylvanians feeling, and can the GOP salvage its economic message?
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: More than 2,000 golden retrievers chase a world record in Buenos Aires
item.description: 2,397 golden retrievers, and their owners, converged on a park in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Monday morning to set a new Guinness world record.
item.content:encoded: 2,397 golden retrievers, and their owners, converged on a park in Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Monday morning to set a new Guinness world record.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Why alcohol hits people harder with age
item.description: If you've noticed that one drink hits you harder than it used to, you're not alone. It's part of the natural aging process, and it may be your body doing you a favor.
item.content:encoded: If you've noticed that one drink hits you harder than it used to, you're not alone. It's part of the natural aging process, and it may be your body doing you a favor.
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Thousands of people in Lagos, Nigeria, have had homes abruptly seized and destroyed
item.description: More than 10,000 people have been violently displaced from a waterfront community in Africa's most populous city -- Lagos, Nigeria.
item.content:encoded: More than 10,000 people have been violently displaced from a waterfront community in Africa's most populous city -- Lagos, Nigeria.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: How ancient curses are helping create a Celtic dictionary
item.description: We speak with a professor in Wales who's working on an ancient Celtic dictionary.
item.content:encoded: We speak with a professor in Wales who's working on an ancient Celtic dictionary.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: 'Remigration,' once a fringe idea, becomes a mantra for the Trump administration
item.description: The recent shooting of two National Guardsmen in D.C. has revived calls from the Trump administration for "reverse migration," or "remigration." But those ideas trace back to European extremists.
item.content:encoded: The recent shooting of two National Guardsmen in D.C. has revived calls from the Trump administration for "reverse migration," or "remigration." But those ideas trace back to European extremists.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Scientists use AI to help make bionic hands work better for people who need them
item.description: Scientists are using artificial intelligence to make bionic limbs act more like natural ones.
item.content:encoded: Scientists are using artificial intelligence to make bionic limbs act more like natural ones.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Venezuelan journalist on life in Caracas over the past year
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks to Venezuelan journalist Tony Frangie, who heads the newsletter Venezuela Weekly, about what life on the ground has been like over the past year.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks to Venezuelan journalist Tony Frangie, who heads the newsletter Venezuela Weekly, about what life on the ground has been like over the past year.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Funding cuts hit a program in Uganda that helped pull people out of poverty
item.description: A program in southwest Uganda aims to address extreme poverty by giving people cash and coaching to help them build a sustainable income. But even the most established programs need to keep evolving.
item.content:encoded: A program in southwest Uganda aims to address extreme poverty by giving people cash and coaching to help them build a sustainable income. But even the most established programs need to keep evolving.
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Farmers' reactions are mixed after Trump announces one-time relief payments
item.description: American farmers have taken a huge financial hit from President Trump's tariffs and trade policies, and are anxiously waiting for the federal financial assistance he announced Monday.
item.content:encoded: American farmers have taken a huge financial hit from President Trump's tariffs and trade policies, and are anxiously waiting for the federal financial assistance he announced Monday.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler
